item.description:
Another Scrabble meetup. The plan from now on is to have these every two weeks, same time, same location.

Recent Meetups have lasted 2-3 hours, with some folks staying for two games, and some folks leaving after just one. Turnout has ranged from 6-20! Skill and experience has ranged too, from novice players to tournament players. One thing has stayed the same, and that's everyone's fun!

Bring a board if you have one, but you are welcome to come even if you don't have one.

A good resource for new players is the Cross Tables "cheat sheet"--a list of two letter and other highly playable words. Look it over if you like, but you don't need to to have fun playing. I do suggest memorizing the two letter words as they will help you a lot in finding a place to play your words. You'll learn a lot of the other words through practice.

A couple notes on the space: Au Bon Pain has been very accommodating of us. They let me know that for the next few weeks-until January--they're going to be busier than normal on Sundays, as they have a flu clinic upstairs in the same building. It's worked out great so far, but just a reminder that we should try to stay in one corner of the restaurant, and try not to move furniture around.

Finally, the dollar is voluntary--it goes to cover Meetup's monthly fees, and nobody will be turned away for not having funds. I ask that you bring a dollar once a month, which will cover you for the whole month even if you come to more than one game. Hope to see you all there!
item.name: Pre-Christmas Scrabble meetup!
